Key Match Events: Burundi took the lead inside the first five minutes of play thanks to an early Bienvenue Kanakimana goal
Burkina Faso conceded three goals before the interval and the Stallions pulled out of sight with a fourth only three minutes after the restart
Pre-Game Insights: Burkina Faso have been a regular feature at the Africa Cup of Nations over the past decade, having only failed to reach the main draw once (2019) in each of the last eight editions
Burkina Faso have scored in every match since Traore's arrival and the eight goals they have netted in this competition to date is the second-most of any participating nation only behind Algeria
Burkina Faso have a strong position to book their spot in Morocco, currently leading the group with seven points and holding a healthy +5 goal difference
Post-Match Reflections: Etienne Ndayiragije would have taken a few positives from the match, the biggest likely being that his side managed to register more shots at goal than their opponents with just 40% possession across the 90
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Stade Felix Houphouet-Boigny, as the stadiums in both Burundi and Burkina Faso failed to meet FIFA standards for international competition

Burkina Faso's Brama Traore has overseen five competitive matches and only lost one, which was his first against Egypt, meaning he is now unbeaten in the last four, including two draws and back-to-back wins ahead of this one
Others: Burundi have now lost all three matches they have ever played against Burkina Faso, conceding nine goals during that period while only scoring twice themselves
